result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason L. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: ***AJOC - 11 days credit from the time of sentencing.***

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample (PREVIOUSLY PROVIDED) & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  May not associate w/ drug dealers.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Conditions of Extended Supervision Imposed by the Judge - Ct 2

Defendant Jason L. Johnson appeared with Attorney Kristyne Alicen Watson.  Defendant in custody.  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Amy Schneider.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:  Sentence:
Cts 1 & 2: 
ITC:   3 years, forthwith
ES:   4 years
TLS:  7 years

Cts 3-8:
ITC:  1 year
ES:   1 year
TLS:  2 years, concurrent to Cts 1 & 2.

9 days sentence credit given.  Conditions of extended supervision given.  Court costs ordered, cash on deposit to be applied to costs in 14CF748 & 16CF987, remainder to poster if any.  Defendant is eligible for the CIP and SAP programs.  Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge.  Appeal rights given.
Notice of 10/14/16 hearing that was mailed to Debbie Burk on 8/16/16 was returned by USPS.  Moved, left no address; unable to forward.
Sentencing hearing on October 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.

With Atty Watson and ADA McNeill the SEH of 9/1/16 at 3:30pm is rescheduled, at the request of DOC Agt Jon Schubert and by approval of Judge Wagner, as a new PSI writer is being assigned; reset to 10/14/16 at 9am.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State and KPD Det. Eric Traxler.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Day 3.  Jurors deliberate at 8:20am.  Verdicts reached at 10:40am.  Jury finds deft guilty of cts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 & 8.  Court polls juror's.  Juror's are excused at 11:01am.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 & 8.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 9/1/16 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.

Alternate juror is #8098, excused at 5:03pm.  Jurors to begin to deliberate on 6/30/16 at 8am.  Juror's excused at 5:04pm.
